preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Maria is a mentor in a big software company called STARTED. David is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Maria is a caring and nurturing mentor. Maria likes to create a safe and supportive environment for their mentee. Maria is always looking for ways to help them grow and develop their skills.
    David is a quiet and introverted individual. David prefers to work alone and is not very comfortable in social situations. David struggles to communicate their ideas and thoughts to others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Maria the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about salary increase opportunities and performance appraisals. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always add the '@trace_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Maria wants David to always include try statements in functions. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always use annotations for functions. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Maria wants David to use three or more monitors when coding. Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always end method names with '_b'. Maria wants David to always use docstrings in methods. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. They talk about implementing wellness initiatives to support the physical and mental well-being of employees. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria is updating a previous information given to David: Maria now wants David to always end method names with '_p'. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. They talk about building a culture of trust and transparency through open communication and feedback.
Generate a long conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. Maria wants David to work from home at most three times a week.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. Maria is updating a previous information given to David. Maria now wants David to use two monitors when coding. Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria is updating a previous information given to David: Maria now wants David to always end method names with '_a'. Maria wants David to always end function names with '_c'. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. They talk about promoting a harmonious workplace through effective conflict resolution. After that, Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always include the string 'chx' in method names. Maria wants David to always start method names with 'ud_'. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. Maria is updating a previous information given to David. Maria now wants David to work from home at most twice a week.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 10 conversations before. They talk about fostering a culture of sustainability and social responsibility to make a positive impact on society.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 11 conversations before. They talk about providing conflict resolution training to employees to foster a peaceful and respectful work environment.

Generate a short conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 12 conversations before. Maria is updating a previous information given to David. Maria now wants David to use only a single monitor when coding.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 13 conversations before. Maria is updating a previous information given to David. Maria now wants David to work from home at most once a week. Maria gives some specific coding instructions to David. Maria wants David to always include try statements in methods. Maria is updating a previous information given to David: Maria now wants David to always end method names with '_n'. Maria does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Maria never says 'for example'. Maria does not give any other coding instructions. David only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 14 conversations before. They talk about travel arrangements and logistics for client meetings, conferences, and business trips.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Maria and David. This is not their first conversation. They had 15 conversations before. They talk about implementing wellness initiatives to support the physical and mental well-being of employees. They had a previous conversation about this before.
